intro: Styphelia gibbosa, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in moist, shaded environments such as pine forests. Its small, bell-shaped flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, dark blue berries. Styphelia gibbosa is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to cool, humid climates.
